quiz.text: In what ratio must a grocer mix two varieties of pulses costing Rs. 15 and Rs. 20 per kg respectively so as to get a mixture worth Rs. 16.5 per kg?
options: 3 : 7
5 : 7
7 : 3
7 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: A dishonest milkman professes to sell his milk at cost price but he mixes it with water and thereby gains 25%. The percentage of water in the mixture is?
options: 4%
6%
20%
25%
None of these

quiz.text: Find the ratio in which rice at Rs. 7.20 a kg be mixed with rice at Rs. 5.70 a kg to produce a mixture worth Rs. 6.30 a kg?
options: 1 : 3
2 : 3
3 : 4
4 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya and Sanjay started a business investing 45000 and 30000 respectively. What will be the ratio between their profit?
options: 2 : 3
3 : 2
4 : 9
Can be determined
None of these

quiz.text: In what ratio must sugar at Rs. 2 per kg be mixed with sugar at Rs. 3.50 per kg so that the mixture be worth Rs. 2.50 per kg?
options: 2 : 1
1 : 5
3 : 1
2 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: 600 gm of Sugar solution has 40% sugar in it. How much sugar should be added to make it 50% in the solution?
options: 60
90
120
150
None of these

quiz.text: Gold is 21 times heavy as compared to water and copper is 11 times heavy as compared to water. In what ratio should these metal be mixed so that the mixture may be 17 times as heavy as water?
options: 1 : 2
2 : 1
3 : 1
3 : 2
None of these

quiz.text: I have 100 books of English. I sold some of these at a profit of 12% and rest at 8% loss. On the whole I got a profit of 11%. How many books were sold at 12% profit by me?
options: 50
56
57
60
95

quiz.text: There are 3 tub which contains mixtures of Milk and Water in the ratio of 5 : 2, 4 : 3 and 3 : 1 respectively. If the mixtures be poured in a single tub. Find the Ratio Milk and Water?
options: 13 : 3
19 : 9
17 : 9
11 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: In what proportion must be Sugar of Rs. 17 per kg mixed with Sugar of Rs. 29 per kg to make mixture of Rs. 20 per kg?
options: 2 : 3
17 : 29
29 : 17
3 : 1
None of these

quiz.text: In what proportion must pulse of Rs. 70 per kg be mixed with pulse of Rs. 45 per kg to give a mixture of Rs. 60 per Kg?
options: 9 : 13
13 : 9
14 : 9
3 : 2
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper has Rs. 50 kg of rice, of part of which he sells at 10% profit and the rest at 5% loss. He gains 7% on the whole. What is the quantity sold at 10% gain?
options: 50
40
10
20
None of these

quiz.text: A man buys 2 Cow for Rs. 2700 and sells one for a loss of 6% and the other for a gain of 7.5% and on the whole, he neither gained nor lost. What does 2nd Cow cost?
options: 1100
1000
1200
6075
None of these

quiz.text: Aditya, Sonal and Nutan contributed Rs. 50,000 for business. Aditya contributed Rs. 4000 more than Sonal and Sonal contributed Rs. 5,000 more than Nutan. Out of total profit of Rs. 70,000 how much did Aditya receive?
options: Rs. 16,000
Rs. 18,000
Rs. 20,000
Rs. 29,400
None of these

quiz.text: The ratio in which two sugar solutions of the concentrations 15% and 40% are to be mixed to get a solution of concentration 30% is:
options: 2 : 3
3 : 2
8 : 9
9 : 8
None of these

quiz.text: Nikita bought 30 kg of wheat at the rate of Rs. 9.50 per kg and 40 kg of wheat at the rate of Rs. 8.50 per kg and mixed them. She sold the mixture at the rate of Rs. 8.90 per kg. Her total profit or loss in the transaction was:
options: Rs. 2 loss
Rs. 2 profit
Rs. 7 loss
Rs. 7 profit
None of these

quiz.text: A mixture of a certain quantity of milk with 16 litres of water is worth 90 paisa per litre. If pure milk be worth Rs. 1.08 per litre. How much milk is there in the mixture?
options: 40 litres
50 litres
60 litres
80 litres
None of these

quiz.text: A person has a chemical of Rs. 25 per litre. In what ratio should water be mixed in the mixture so that by selling it at Rs. 20 per litre he may get a profit of 25%?
options: 14 : 9
16 : 9
9 : 14
9 : 16
None of these

quiz.text: A mixture of 40 litres of milk and water contains 10% water. How much water must be added to make 20% water in the new mixture?
options: 3 litres
4 litres
5 litres
6 litres
None of these

quiz.text: If 2 kg of metal, of which 1/3  is zinc and the rest is copper, be mixed with 3 kg of metal, of which 1/4  is zinc and the rest is copper, what is the ratio of zinc to copper in the mixture?
options: 13 : 42
17 : 43
19 : 43
15 : 42
None of these

quiz.text: 50 g of an alloy of gold and silver contains 80% gold by weight. The quantity of gold, that is to be mixed up with this alloy, so that it may contain 95% gold, is:
options: 200 g
150 g
50 g
10 g
None of these

quiz.text: In what ratio must water be mixed with milk to gain 16% on selling the mixture at cost price?
options: 1 : 6
4 : 25
2 : 3
4 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: In what ratio must a grocer mix two varieties of tea worth Rs. 60 per kg and Rs. 65 per kg so that by selling the mixture at Rs. 68.20 per kg he may gain 10%?
options: 3 : 2
3 : 4
3 : 5
4 : 5
None of these

quiz.text: A milk vendor has 2 cans of milk. The first contains 25% water and the rest milk. The second contains 50% water. How much milk should he mix from each of the containers so as to get 12 litres of milk such that the ratio of water to milk is 3 : 5?
options: 4 litres, 8 litres
6 litres, 6 litres
5 litres, 7 litres
7 litres, 5 litres
None of these

quiz.text: How many kilogram of sugar costing Rs. 9 per kg must be mixed with 27 kg of sugar costing Rs. 7 per kg so that there may be a gain of 10% by selling the mixture at Rs. 9.24 per kg?
options: 36 kg
42 kg
54 kg
63 kg
None of these

quiz.text: A container contains 40 litres of milk. From this container 4 litres of milk was taken out and replaced by water. This process was repeated further two times. How much milk is now contained by the container?
options: 26.34 litres
27.36 litres
28 litres
29.16 litres
None of these

quiz.text: In a mixture of milk and water of volume 30 litre the ratio of water and milk is 3 : 7. How much quantity of water will be added to the mixture to make the ratio of milk and water 1 : 2.
options: 23 Litre
21 Litre
12 Litre
33 Litre
None of these

quiz.text: The cost of Type 1 rice is Rs. 15 per kg and Type 2 rice is Rs. 20 per kg. If both Type 1 and Type 2 are mixed in the ratio of 2 : 3, then the price per kg of the mixed variety of rice is?
options: Rs. 18
Rs. 18.50
Rs. 19
Rs. 19.50
None of these

quiz.text: A merchant has 1000 kg of sugar, part of which he sells at 8% profit and the rest at 18% profit. If he gains 14% on the whole then the quantity sold at 18% profit is:
options: 400 kg
560 kg
600 kg
640 kg
None of these

quiz.text: In an Examination out of 900 students 85% of the boys and 70% of girls passed. How many girls appeared in the examination, if total pass percentage was 75%?
options: 400
500
600
700
None of these

quiz.text: 400 gm of salt solution has 40% salt in it. How much salt should be added to make it 50% in the solution?
options: 60 g
70 g
65 g
80 g
None of these

quiz.text: There are two containers of equal capacity. The ratio of milk to water in the first container is 3 : 1, in the second container is 5 : 2. If they are mixed up, then the ratio of milk to water in the mixture will be:
options: 28 : 41
41 : 28
15 : 41
41 : 15
None of these

quiz.text: In a mixture of 60 L the ratio of acid and water is 2 : 1. If the ratio of acid and water is to be 1 : 2, then the amount of water in litres to be added in mixture is:
options: 55
60
50
45
None of these

quiz.text: In a mixture of 25 L, the ratio of acid to water is 4 : 1. Another 3 L of water is added to the mixture. The ratio of acid to water in the new mixture is:
options: 5 : 2
2 : 5
3 : 5
5 : 3
None of these

quiz.text: In a 729 L mixture of milk and water, the ratio of milk to water is 7: 2. To get a new mixture containing milk and water in the ratio of 7 : 3, the amount of water to be added is:
options: 81 L
71 L
56 L
50 L
None of these

quiz.text: In 50 g alloy of gold and silver, the gold is 80% by weight. How much gold should be mixed to this alloy, so that the weight of gold would become 95%?
options: 200 g
150 g
50 g
10g
None of these

quiz.text: An alloy contains copper, zinc and nickel in the ratio of 5 : 3 : 2. The quantity of nickel in kg that must be added to 100 kg of this alloy to have the new ratio 5 : 3 : 3 is:
options: 8
10
12
15
None of these

quiz.text: A shopkeeper bought 15 kg of rice at the rate of Rs. 29 per kg and 25 kg of rice at the rate of Rs. 20 per kg. He sold the mixture of both types of rice at the rate of Rs. 27 per kg. His profit in this transaction is:
options: Rs. 125
Rs. 150
Rs. 140
Rs. 145
None of these

quiz.text: In 40 L mixture of milk and water, the ratio of milk to water is 7: 1. In order to make the ratio of milk and water 3: 1, the quantity of water (in liters) that should be added to the mixture will be:
options: 6
6.5
6(2/3)
6(3/4)
None of these

quiz.text: A mixture of 30 L contain milk and water in the ratio of 7 : 3. How much water should be added to it so that the ratio of milk and water becomes 3: 7?
options: 40 L
49 L
56 L
63 L
None of these

quiz.text: Zinc and copper are in the ratio 5 : 3 in 400 g of an alloy. How much of copper (in g) should be added to make the ratio 5 : 4?
options: 72
200
50
66
None of these

quiz.text:
Vessel A is completely filled with honey and milk in ratio 5 : 7 while vessel B is completely filled with water and honey in ratio 2 : 1. Contents of both the vessels are poured into a larger vessel C. The total quantity of water and honey in vessel C is twice the quantity of milk in vessel C. Final quantity of mixture in vessel C is 210 liters. 

Quantity I: Capacity of vessel B in liters.

Quantity II: 90 liters.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Capacities of three vessels A, B and C are the ratio 2 : 3 : 5 respectively. First, vessel A is filled with milk and then content of vessel A is poured into vessel B. Now vessel B is filled with water then content of vessel B is poured into vessel C. Now vessel C is filled with milk. Quantity of milk in vessel C is 45 liters more than that water in vessel C. 

Quantity I: Capacity of vessel C in liters.

Quantity II: 60 liters.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Capacities of three vessels A, B and C are the ratio 3 : 4 : 5 respectively. A, B and C are filled with water, honey and milk respectively and then contents of these vessels are poured into a larger vessel D. Now A, B and C are again filled with milk, water and honey respectively and then contents of these vessels are poured again into D. If we add 20 liters of milk in vessel D, the quantities of milk and honey in vessel D will become equal.  

Quantity I: Capacity of vessel A in liters.

Quantity II: 80 liters.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Three vessels A, B and C of same capacity are all full. Vessel A and B contain mixture of milk and water in ratios 4 : 1 and 7 : 3 while vessel C contains only pure milk. The contents of all the vessels are poured into a larger vessel D. After drawing 30 liters of the mixture from vessel D, the final quantity of water in Vessel D is 40 liters.  

Quantity I: Capacity of each vessel in liters.

Quantity II: 90 liters.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
There are three vessel A, B and C. Vessel A contains mixture of milk and water in ratio 3 : 1. Vessel B contains 20 litres of pure water while vessel C contains 30 litres of pure milk. Half of the content of vessel A is first poured into vessel B. Then content of vessel B is poured into vessel C and finally contents of vessel C is poured into vessel A. The final ratio of milk and water in vessel A is 9 : 4.  

Quantity I: Initial quantity of mixture in vessel A.

Quantity II: 80 litres.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Vessel A having a total capacity of 75 liters contains water and milk in a ratio of 2 : 3. Another vessel B contains milk and water in a ratio of 5: 4. Contents of both the vessels are poured into a third vessel. 10 liters of milk are added to the third vessel and the final ratio of water and milk is now 2 : 3. 

Quantity I: Capacity of vessel B in liters.

Quantity II: 90 liters.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
There are 3 vessels A, B and C full of mixture of milk and water. Vessel A contains 5 liters of water and 25 liters of milk, Vessel B contains 15 liters of water and 30 liters of milk and Vessel C contains water and milk in the ratio 1 : 5. 20%, 40% and 30% of the total mixtures from vessels A, B and C respectively is taken and poured into a fourth vessel. The ratio of milk and water in the fourth vessel is 16 : 5. 

Quantity I: Capacity of vessel C in litres.

Quantity II: 80 litres.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text: An oil refinery takes 1000 L of crude oil as input and after refining for 1 h gives a certain amount of output oil x L. This can be sold in the market at a profit of Rs. 30 per L. If this oil is further refined for  h, it gives oil y L. This can be sold at a profit of Rs. 50 per L. The output and input ratio at both stages is 90%. The maximum profit that can be earned from 1000 L of crude input is:
options: Rs. 40000
Rs. 30000
Rs. 27000
Rs. 40500
None of these

quiz.text:
Quantity I The amount of acid was drawn off initially. Several liters of acid was drawn off a 54-liter vessel full of acid and an equal amount of water was added. Again the same volume of the mixture was drawn off and replaced by water. As a result, the vessel contained 24 liters of pure acid.

Quantity II Amount of tea worth Rs 25 per kg blended with 30 kg of tea worth Rs 30 per kg so that by selling the blended variety at Rs 30.25 per kg there is a gain of 10%.

                                                                                                                                            

Note: Compare the magnitudes of both quantities.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation
